interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Seven Days in May (1964)
Review Date: 2021/04/16
Store: John Frankenheimer  (Director),     Burt Lancaster  (Actor),     Kirk Douglas  (Actor)    &                   0                  more   Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Warner Home Video, All Titles
Product Description: ["It happens with startling swiftness and violence. An armed cadre seizes state control. Fortunately, a coup d'etat can't happen here. Or can it? A classic of suspense directed by John Frankenheimer (The Manchurian Candidate, Ronin) and written for the screen by Rod Serling (The Twilight Zone), Seven Days in May tautly explores that possibility. At odds are a popular general and Joint Chiefs of Staff Chairman (Burt Lancaster) and an unpopular president (Fredric March) with a pacifist agenda. At stake is the survival of the Republic. A vigilant colonel (Kirk Douglas) uncovers the scheme. But are the seven fateful days ahead enough time to derail a takeover? The clock is ticking."]
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Action & Adventure', 'Format': 'NTSC', 'Contributor': "Edmond O'Brien, John Frankenheimer, Hugh Marlowe, Kirk Douglas, Fredric March, Whit Bissell, George Macready, Martin Balsam, Burt Lancaster, Ava GardnerEdmond O'Brien, John Frankenheimer, Hugh Marlowe, Kirk Douglas, Fredric March, Whit Bissell, George Macready, Martin Balsam, Burt Lancaster, Ava Gardner   See more", 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 58 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Director': 'John Frankenheimer', 'Media Format': 'NTSC', 'Run time': '1 hour and 58 minutes', 'Release date': 'November 22, 2016', 'Actors': "Burt Lancaster, Kirk Douglas, Fredric March, Ava Gardner, Edmond O'Brien", 'Studio': 'Warner Archive Collection', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: Excellent movie. Explores the balance of power between the military and the civilian authority and the duty that each owes to the country. Powerful acting. Thoughtful script.
Review Title: Place your bets
Rating: 5.0

reference_summary:
{'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Edgar Wright'], 'Producers': ['Nira Park'], 'Starring': ['Simon Pegg', 'Nick Frost', 'Paddy Considine'], 'Studio': ['NBC Universal']}
A deep exploration of human connectedness and brotherly love in the face of cruel time. Add pubs, car chases, explosions, 1000 funny jokes, and you'll have the thread of this film. Pegg and Frost are on par with the great comedy teams of all time.
A Riot
{'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Greg Mottola'], 'Producers': ['Tim Bevan', 'Nira Park', 'Eric Fellner'], 'Starring': ['Simon Pegg', 'Nick Frost', 'Seth Rogen'], 'Studio': ['UNIVERSAL PAY TELEVISION']}
I really enjoy these two as a comedy team. The film is very funny and has a lot of social commentary on the US.
Great Movie for a laugh
{'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Lana Wachowski', 'Tom Tykwer', 'Lilly Wachowski'], 'Producers': ['Stefan Arndt', 'Alex Boden', 'David Brown', 'John Chong', 'José Luis Escolar', 'Peter Grossman', 'Grant Hill'], 'Starring': ['Tom Hanks', 'Halle Berry', 'Jim Broadbent'], 'Studio': ['Warner Bros.']}
Gadzooks it made my head hurt trying to rationalize why I was spending time watching it. I loved the Matrix. This was nothing like it. I wanted it to be deep and profound...Nope.
Pompous

profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Content Preferences:** Enjoys films that blend humor with deeper themes of human relationships and emotional connections, particularly stories involving camaraderie and significant life events. Appreciates social commentary within comedic frameworks but maintains a critical view towards content that lacks depth. Recently demonstrated a strong affinity for action-packed narratives and suspenseful plots that provoke thought.

- **Media Style:** Favors comedic narratives interspersed with intense action, including car chases and stunts. Values clever dialogue and emotionally resonant moments, reflected in recent perfect ratings for films showcasing exceptional execution and thrilling experiences.

- **Rating Behavior:** Continues to exhibit an upward trend in overall ratings, favoring high-quality production, robust casts, and engaging storytelling. Recently, the user has embraced films that delve into political and military dramas, appreciating scripts that explore complex power dynamics.

- **Cast Preferences:** Enjoys collaborations among specific comedic actors, particularly Simon Pegg and Nick Frost, and is increasingly drawn to seasoned action stars and powerful performances.

- **Content Advisory Tolerance:** Open to mature themes, including violence, when they enhance the overall experience, as evidenced by recent selections that offer both action and depth.

- **Media Accessibility:** Prefers content in English and values accessible features such as subtitles.

The user appreciates a dynamic blend of humor and action, maintaining high expectations for content that offers both meaningful engagement and entertainment.
